meta.description: A cocktail of non-toxic chemicals could hold the key to beating untreatable cancer and relapses, new research says.

title: Non-toxic food chemicals 'may hold key' to cancer treatment
cleaned_text:
Professor Wen Jiang has been looking at traditional Chinese medicines as a means of treating cancer

Chemicals in food could hold the key to beating untreatable cancer and relapses, researchers have claimed.

Cardiff University scientists said highly toxic therapies had a limited ability to stop most cancers.

Instead, the researchers - working with scientists from across the world - said they would recommend low-toxicity chemicals from food and vegetables.

Clinical trials are under way in China with patients suffering from lung, liver and gastric cancers.
